author: danielknopik
content: Hey, network simulation is exactly what I do - Using shadow (https://shadow.github.io/) to simulate various configurations and then comparing them with the captured metrics (bandwidth, consensus stability across the network, etc). Up until now, I put my focus on PeerDAS, but with the discussion about blobs going on and the importance of IDONTWANT being discussed again, I started some simulations to compare the bandwidth requirements of 3/6 vs 4/8 with a varying number of nodes using IDONTWANT. I hope to have the data out before next ACD.

author: parithosh
content: Can you modify when a block is produced in a slot with shadow? If so, could you also add a simulation for timing games? I.e, produce the block at 2.6s-3.5s into the slot instead of within the first second of the slot.

author: raikage_inashi
content: Must one be part of the protocol fellowship to participate

author: kolbyml
content: Everything is permission-less so if you want to participate you can. Every EPF has had quite a few successful permission-less participates

author: kolbyml
content: Most people I talk to got jobs working on Ethereum by contributing to projects in there free time

author: raikage_inashi
content: I mean for example if I have an idea of a research on something about ethereum can I just join

author: kolbyml
content: Yes you can just join most discussions/calls as they are open to the public

author: kolbyml
content: Another way you can contribute is contributing directly to the open source software that powers Ethereum

author: raikage_inashi
content: I do that sometimes with Reth
